intro: Perymenium hintoniorum var. gypsophilum, commonly known as the gypsophilum perymenium, is a rare and specialized plant species. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, often hairy foliage. The plant typically produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in well-drained, calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
